Authors:
Sinang Hongsanan, Chada Norphanphoun, Kasun Madhusanka
Thambugala, Naruemon Huanraluek, Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon
Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of Muyocopron thailandica sp.
nov.
Keywords:
1 new species, Dothideomycetes, Morphology,
Muyocopronaceae, Phylogenetic analysis
Abstract:
Muyocopron species are mostly found on dried branches,
twigs and leaves of terrestrial plants. They are characterised by having
dark brown to black, flattened ascomata, with a central ostiole,
appearing as small black dots or thick stromata, forming superficially
on the substrate, without mycelium. Asci are bitunicate, 8-spored and
contain ellipsioidal, hyaline ascospores. Muyocopron thailandica sp.
nov. was collected in northern Thailand, and extracted DNA directly from
the fruiting body. Multi-gene phylogenetic analyses based on LSU and ITS
sequence data indicate that the new species forms a distinct lineage
within the Muyocopron clade, and is related to M. castanopsis and M.
lithocarpi. The new species differs from M. castanopsis in having
ellipsoid to subcylindrical asci, with a very short and thin pedicel,
oval to obovoid ascospores. Asci and ascospores of M. thailandica are
larger than those of M. castanopsis and M. lithocarpi. Description and
illustrations of the new species are provided in this study.
